meanings.sent1: Wearing a helmet can preclude head injuries during sports.
meanings.sent2: Locking the door can preclude burglars from entering the house.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fly without wings would preclude a successful takeoff.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking precluded any further misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The strong security measures preclude any unauthorized access to the building.

meanings.sent1: Studying well can preclude failing the exam.
meanings.sent2: Installing a security system can preclude break-ins at home.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a raincoat indoors would preclude getting wet from unexpected rain.
meanings.sent4: His timely intervention precluded a major disaster.
meanings.sent5: The high fence precludes any view of the neighboring property.

meanings.sent1: Taking medicine can preclude getting sick.
meanings.sent2: Clear communication can preclude misunderstandings in a relationship.
meanings.sent3: Wearing sunglasses at night would preclude seeing clearly.
meanings.sent4: The early warning system precludes any surprises during the event.
meanings.sent5: Regular maintenance precludes breakdowns in machinery.
